item.title: Alpine.js Plugin
item.description: $fir.emit(id, params) # $fir.emit is a magic function that returns an event handler(function(event){...}) that emits an event with the given id and params to the current fir route handler. id must be a string and is required. If not passed as an argument, id is picked from the DOM in the following order: element.id form.action="/?event=myevent" button.formaction="/?event=myevent" Usage: <button @click="$fir.emit('inc')">+</button> <button id="dec"@click="$fir.emit()">-</button> <form id="createTodo" method="post" @submit.prevent="$fir.emit()"> <input type="text" name="todo" placeholder="a new todo" /> <button type="submit">Submit</button> </form> params can be of any type and is optional.
